result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Harry Lee Schumacher

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Harry Lee Schumacher in court.  Attorney Annette E Rauch in court for Harry Lee Schumacher.  Attorney Tyler Rubenzer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference. 
Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Court grants request.
Case adjourned to Branch 13. 
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Harry Lee Schumacher in court.  Attorney Annette E Rauch in court for Harry Lee Schumacher.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Pretrial conference held. Defense has received discovery and wishes to pursue veterans treatment court. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TWH
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 09/08/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Harry Lee Schumacher in court.  Attorney Annette E Rauch in court for Harry Lee Schumacher.  Student intern Lukas Jaeger along with prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Reserve, Branch 13.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
